scenarios.name: At the Airport
scenarios.description: Essential phrases for navigating the airport

expressions.english: Is this the boarding gate?
expressions.context: When looking for your gate at the airport
expressions.tips: Is this...? 패턴은 확인할 때 사용해요

commonMistakes.explanation: Use 'Is this...' for questions, not 'Here is'

expressions.english: Here is my passport.
expressions.context: When showing your passport at check-in or security
expressions.tips: Here is + 명사: 무언가를 건네줄 때 사용

expressions.english: I would like a window seat, please.
expressions.pronunciation: /aɪ wʊd laɪk ə ˈwɪndoʊ siːt pliːz/
expressions.context: When checking in for your flight

commonMistakes.correct: I would like a window seat, please.
commonMistakes.explanation: 'I want' sounds too direct. Use 'I would like' for polite requests.
commonMistakes.explanationKo: 'I want'는 너무 직접적이에요. 정중하게 'I would like'를 사용하세요.

expressions.korean: 짐은 몇 개까지 맡길 수 있나요?
expressions.english: How many bags can I check in?
expressions.pronunciation: /haʊ ˈmeni bæɡz kæn aɪ tʃek ɪn/
expressions.context: When asking about luggage at check-in

expressions.english: What time is boarding?
expressions.context: When asking about your flight schedule

expressions.english: Can I bring this on the plane?
expressions.pronunciation: /kæn aɪ brɪŋ ðɪs ɑːn ðə pleɪn/
expressions.context: When asking about carry-on items at security

commonMistakes.correct: Can I bring this on the plane?
commonMistakes.explanation: Use 'Can I...' to ask for permission

scenarios.name: At the Hotel
scenarios.description: Checking in and communicating with hotel staff

expressions.english: I would like to check in, please.
expressions.pronunciation: /aɪ wʊd laɪk tuː tʃek ɪn pliːz/
expressions.context: When arriving at the hotel front desk

expressions.english: I have a reservation. The name is Kim Chulsoo.
What is the WiFi password?

commonMistakes.explanation: Questions start with 'What is...' in English

expressions.english: What time is breakfast?

expressions.korean: 수건 좀 더 주실 수 있나요?
expressions.english: Could I have some more towels, please?
expressions.pronunciation: /kʊd aɪ hæv sʌm mɔːr ˈtaʊəlz pliːz/

scenarios.name: Asking for Directions
scenarios.description: How to ask for and understand directions

expressions.english: Excuse me. Where is the subway station?
expressions.pronunciation: /ɪkˈskjuːz miː wer ɪz ðə ˈsʌbweɪ ˈsteɪʃn̩/

expressions.english: How far is it from here?
Can I walk there?
expressions.context: When asking if the destination is walkable

expressions.english: Go left.
Go straight for two blocks.
How do I get to this address?
expressions.pronunciation: /haʊ duː aɪ ɡet tuː ðɪs əˈdres/
expressions.context: When showing an address and asking for directions

commonMistakes.correct: How do I get to this address?
commonMistakes.explanation: 'How do I get to...?' is the correct pattern for asking directions
commonMistakes.explanationKo: 길을 물을 때는 'How do I get to...?'를 사용해요

scenarios.name: Restaurant Ordering
scenarios.description: Ordering food and drinks at a restaurant

expressions.english: Table for two, please.
Could I see the menu, please?
expressions.context: When you want to see the menu

expressions.english: I'll have this, please.
expressions.context: When pointing at something on the menu
expressions.tips: 'I'll have...'는 주문할 때 아주 자연스러운 표현

expressions.english: Could I have some water, please?
Could I have the bill, please?
Do you recommend this?
